title: Infinix X1 100 cm (40 inch) Full HD LED Smart Android TV  (40x1)

product_specification.In The Box: 1 U LED TV,1U remote control, 2 U battery,2 U Base ,4 U Screw ,1 U User manual ,1 U Warrenty card,1 U Quick start guide ,1 U Composite cable
product_specification.Supported Video Formats: MPEG, MPG, VOB, DAT, AVI, MP4, MOV, MKV, FLV, ASF, 3PG
product_specification.Supported Audio Formats: MP3, M4A, WAV, RM, AC3, FLAC, OGG, AAC
product_specification.Content Providers: Google Play Store, Netflix, Prime Video, YouTube
product_specification.Other Convenience Features: Eye Care Mode, HDR 10, HLG, Bezel-less Design, Built-in Chromecast
product_specification.Not Covered in Warranty: Any Damage Caused due to Improper Self-installation by Customer or Any Unauthorized Technician. Physical Damage, Dent, Dropping or Excessive Shock, Scratches due to Normal Wear and Tear. Damage Caused due to Natural Act of God, Fire, Lightening, Ingress of Water, Accident or Damage by Any External Force. Warranty does not Cover Any External Accessories (Such as Battery, Cable etc.) Any Damage Caused due to Tampering of the Product, Disassembly by Any Unauthorized Agent, Liability for Loss of Data, Recorded Images or Business Opportunity Loss.
product_specification.Installation & Demo Details: "Please note that any unauthorized handling or self-installation of the product will lead to return & product warranty being void. Flipkart will facilitate Installation & Demo at time of your convenience from an authorized service engineer. The authorized service engineer will be providing detailed demo. The service engineer will install your new TV, either on wall mount or on table top. The wall mount is not provided free of cost and is chargeable to the customer. The cost of wall mount is Rs. 399 (inclusive of applicable taxes) and will be available with service engineer for purchase. - Connecting with available power source - Connecting / Setting up various available input source for Audio Video based on model - Connecting with available wifi (for smart TV) - Checking TV for proper functioning - Demonstration of the TV and its features"

product_description.Bezel-less Frame: This TV features a True Bezel-less frame of 2.4 mm to give you an expansive view of your content. Thanks to its high screen-to-body ratio, you can enjoy an immersive TV-watching experience as soon as you switch on the TV.
product_description.EPIC 2.0 Picture Engine: Thanks to the EPIC 2.0 Picture Engine with HDR and HLG and 350 nits, the colours, sharpness, and the contrast of the pictures will be greatly improved on the screen. Your whole viewing experience will be better, thanks to the super bright panel of the TV.

This review is on the installation service provided by Jeeves. Terrible!

Its 5 days and the wall mount is not done. Just for setting up the TV and connecting to my wifi router does not need an installation process.

The representative comes at his own time, you will not be able to get in touch with him to schedule a mutually convenient time, customer service is of no good, then he arrives at a mist inappropriate time, and not able to put up the wall mount because there is a nut missing in their mount and would ask you if you have some jugaad at your home to fit the peg in the hole.

Eventually it is waste of time with zero output, Flipkart should seriously consider having some quality control on their third party partners. Exasperating experience!!

Regarding the product, it is average. I wanted to buy a low budget TV and had no specific expectations. And so is it, average picture (like beauty mode selifie in chinese mobiles) quality, average sound quality, decent connectivity. Works for me, but if you have higher expectations for TV experience, this isn't the one for you.

Regd connectivity: remote sensitivity low, optical output does not work

The best television brands are always Sony, Samsung, LG because of their panel, picture and sound quality. Other brands like Mi, Vu are all secondary brands and the quality difference compared to the best brands are very much visible without looking at the specification itself. This is where I was amazed getting the Infinix television. The specification comparison with brands like Samsung was sort of close to identical. After using it I will definitely say Infinix brand has every right to be among the list of best brands and not in the secondary brand list. We can check the screen quality by touching the screen and by doing so we will see pressure points. The best brands won't show lighter shade pressure points or no pressure points at all. But the secondary brands will have darkish pressure points. Infinix television has got only lighter shade pressure point. Anyone without technical knowledge could check the screen quality in this manner. I will write some pros and cons below:

Pros
1. Great picture and sound quality.
2. Great connectivity.
3. Looks premium.
4. Easy set up.
5. Easy remote functionality.
6. Installation was very good and prompt.

Cons
Haven't seen any cons for this television as of now but I do want to check how the service centre experience will be like. That doesn't change the quality of the product though.

Got this model for Rs 10,000+ which is a great buy because it's definitely worth Rs 20,000+. If you can't afford a Samsung or Sony, Infinix can become the next choice without compromising on quality.

Other brands Chromecast is very simple and elegant but Infinix put toughed. That's only main part in android tv. What is the use for Android tv? Infinix makes me so disappointed.

Let's get the unimpressive out of the way. I'm not satisfied with the Android OS experience on this TV. The OS works fine and smooth for the most part, but on occasion the interface would lag, and button presses take several seconds to be registered. This occasional choppy UI experience doesn't feel pleasant at all. This may have to do more with issues in the Android OS than anything with the TV hardware. But, anyone looking for a TV specifically for smart features may look at other options in this price segment.

Now, on to the display. I am overall pleased with the display quality. The display is a VA panel which produces good enough contrast. The downside of a VA panel is relatively poor viewing angles, which is not ideal for family viewing. For the colour reproduction, initially the colours looked off (too saturated) in the deep Reds. I went in the Settings and reduced the saturation for Red and then in the "10 point color" setting, reduced the saturation for Reds with 70% gain and above. And, this did improve the image, and now the colours look fairly balanced. Also, the Sharpness setting should be kept at zero, anything above adds artificial sharpening to the image.

And the remote which connects via Bluetooth, works fine, has a textured back and feels nice in the hand.

All in all, for a dumb TV, this is a really good option. And, for smart features, I can't say how it compares with other similarly priced TVs.

The best television brands are always Sony, Samsung, LG because of their panel, picture and sound quality. Other brands like Mi, Vu are all secondary brands and the quality difference compared to the best brands are very much visible without looking at the specification itself. This is where I was amazed getting the Infinix television. The specification comparison with brands like Samsung was sort of close to identical. After using it I will definitely say Infinix brand has every right to be among the list of best brands and not in the secondary brand list. We can check the screen quality by touching the screen and by doing so we will see pressure points. The best brands won't show lighter shade pressure points or no pressure points at all. But the secondary brands will have darkish pressure points. Infinix television has got only lighter shade pressure point. Anyone without technical knowledge could check the screen quality in this manner. I will write some pros and cons below:

Pros
1. Great picture and sound quality.
2. Great connectivity.
3. Looks premium.
4. Easy set up.
5. Easy remote functionality.
6. Installation was very good and prompt.

Cons
Haven't seen any cons for this television as of now but I do want to check how the service centre experience will be like. That doesn't change the quality of the product though.

Got this model for Rs 10,000+ which is a great buy because it's definitely worth Rs 20,000+. If you can't afford a Samsung or Sony, Infinix can become the next choice without compromising on quality.

It's my secondary TV and i purchased for my home office where I can occasionally watch some OTT series or live cricket. I exchange this with my 32 inch 10 yo LCD as i was struggling to watch OTT content on the same. So my initial first impresions:
40 inch size is perfect for 12x12 room and it's very light in weight and also thin bezels.
Pros:
1. Good picture quality, brightness is superb with 350 Nits ( but not to be compared with LG or Sony) l. Better than some rivals at similar price range.
2. Bluetooth connectivity with my Bose soundlink is flawless with absolutely no lag/delay. However I noticed that audio gets disconnected for a sec intermittently during the video. If this is a Software issue, company should fix with update.
3.Light remote however there was no need of number pad.
4. Bezel less design and it's looks great in the wall.
5. Sound is not great but not bad too, it's average. Dolby seems to be a gimmick.
6. Lastly, it's high value for money

Cons:
1. Biggest, why there is no 5Ghz wifi support?
2. Wall mount is missing, they should at least provide screws for wall mount and just not for table top only.
3. 1GB RAM with just 8 gb storage is letdown as there are many OTT apps nowadays. sluggish interface, takes around 2 minutes post restart for apps to become fully functional.
4. 2 gen old Android version which is Android TV 9. Infinix can ramp up their sales by providing atleast Android TV 10. Some of other brands are already providing Android TV 11.


Overall ,i like picture quality which is FHD and it's a great value for money if anyone is under 20k. Go for it, easily comparable with brands that offers same specs but at more price. Only apprehension, company should focus more on customer retention as to provide updates and more models to customers.

Picture - Very good quality, needs some self adjusting but produces good images
Audio - Audio is loud but depth is missing. Use Dolby Processing option to produce acceptable sound.
Connectivity - No hassles with BT speakers or headphones. Enough ports for standard usage.
Remote - Most disappointing feature, as voice commands are not supported. Even Google android TV remote from playstore doesn't connect. Other than that, remote has some good features with media control buttons as well. Seller OmniTechRetail avoided my questions very cleverly and removed the 43" Remote control photo silently.
OS - Sometimes it is laggy when TV has just started. Inbuilt Pango browser is just ok-ish. Haven't faced any lagging after 2-3 minutes of start. RAM usage is between 50-70% loaded or unloaded.
